Technique: CARVED; PAINTED; WRITTEN WITH A REED PEN/REED WITH SPLIT NIB
Name: Stela of Tuthmosis
Description: Painted limestone stela divided into two registers. The decorated part takes up most of the space and depicts a squatting baboon on a high pedestal on the left. On his head is a full moon and a crescent moon. On the right is a man holding a bunch of papyrus. The inscription in the lower part of the stela consists of the offering formula for the god Thoth.
